title: Tightening the Flow: Founder → App Intelligence → Portfolio → LinkedIn
excerpt: We wired a clean path from the Founder hub to App Intelligence to the Portfolio and out to LinkedIn. Four clicks, zero friction.
content:
# Why the flow matters
When people discover you, they shouldn't have to guess where to go next. Today we tightened the complete path:

1. **Founder Hub** (jaytranberg.com) → positioning and quick proof.
2. **App Intelligence** → what we build and how we ship.
3. **Portfolio** → hard evidence: metrics, projects, downloads.
4. **LinkedIn** → social proof + contact.

## What changed
- Consistent **CTA language** and button order across pages.
- Matching **metrics strips** (30+ shipped projects, 6 categories, CI/CD).
- Footer links standardized, including **Founder: JayTranberg.com**.

## Result
Less friction, more signal. Visitors get the story in seconds, and every route ends in a contact surface.

title: Portfolio Refresh: Metrics-First + Resume & Appendix Downloads
excerpt: Lead with evidence. We elevated the metrics strip and added one-click downloads for Resume and Project Appendix.
content:
## What shipped
- A bold, **metrics-first hero** (results at the top, not buried below).
- **Download Resume** and **Project Appendix** buttons wired to `/public` assets.
- Consistent link set: Resume, Appendix, LinkedIn.

## Why
Recruiters skim. Investors skim. Leading with metrics and giving a fast path to PDFs respects their time and increases replies.

title: App Intelligence Sync: Descriptions & KPIs Now Match the Portfolio
excerpt: We brought App Intelligence copy and KPIs in line with the portfolio: fewer gaps, tighter story.
content:
We aligned product blurbs and KPIs across the AI studio site and the portfolio:

- **Dr. Epidermis / SkinScan**: `3+8 cls`, `80.2%` 8-class validation, Top-3 breakdown.
- **Covercraft**: Lyrics + Predict, FAL + DeepAI upscaler, T2V pipeline.
- **Snowman**: TRL-5→6, ESP32-S3, DS18B20 sensor array.

Copy now reads the same everywhere. Less doubt, more trust.

title: Blog Goes Live: JSON → Markdown → Modal
excerpt: A lightweight blog system using JSON posts, Markdown content, and a modal reader powered by Marked.
content:
## Stack
- **Data**: `posts.json` with `{ id, title, slug, date, tags, excerpt, content }`.
- **Render**: `BlogIndex` + `BlogPostModal`.
- **Parser**: `marked` for Markdown → HTML.

## Why this design
- Dead simple to version and diff in Git.
- Easy to surface on the homepage.
- Zero CMS overhead, instant edits.

title: Covercraft Update: KPI Cards + Predictive Mode
excerpt: We clarified the two core modes and highlighted the upscaling/transcription pipeline.
content:
- **Dual modes**: Generate Lyrics + Predict continuation with rhyme structure.
- **Imaging**: FAL generation → DeepAI upscale pass.
- **Transcribe**: Sheet-music transcription surfaced in the catalog.

The catalog now tells the story in one glance.

title: Snowman Note: ESP32-S3 Progress and the TRL-5→6 Path
excerpt: Steady progress on hardware and telemetry as we push from TRL-5 toward TRL-6.
content:
## Recent progress
- **ESP32-S3** firmware stable on displays + sensors.
- **DS18B20** array (×5) logging cleanly.
- Dashboard styling aligned with portfolio look.

## Next
- Expand environmental logs, connect upstream to analytics, and prep field readiness.

title: Shipping Discipline: Netlify + Render, Minimal Friction
excerpt: A simple deployment footprint keeps feature work moving: Netlify (frontends) + Render (backends).
content:
## Why this setup
- **Fast previews** for frontends.
- **Low-ceremony** deploys for microservices.
- Good enough observability to catch regressions.

Keep infra boring so product can be exciting.
